name: Special Needs Aquatic Program
description: SNAP serves children 1-18 years old. Our goal is a one-to-one, swimmer-to-helper ratio. Classes have approximately six swimmers, six volunteer helpers, and a head instructor. Classes meet for 45 minutes once a week and are currently held in Berkeley and Palo Alto YMCA.
fullDescription: SNAP serves children 1-18 years old. Our goal is a one-to-one, swimmer-to-helper ratio. Classes have approximately six swimmers, six volunteer helpers, and a head instructor. Classes meet for 45 minutes once a week and are currently held in Berkeley and Palo Alto YMCA.
whatTheyOffer: SNAP serves children 1-18 years old. Our goal is a one-to-one, swimmer-to-helper ratio. Classes have approximately six swimmers, six volunteer helpers, and a head instructor. Classes meet for 45 minutes once a week and are currently held in Berkeley and Palo Alto YMCA.
howToGetIt: Registration is required for each semester.
cost: The average cost is ~$20 per class. SNAP offers scholarships to children and families with financial needs.
agency: United Cerebral Palsy of the Golden Gate
